title: Part (a)
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.
descriptions:
Student response does not accurately include the following criteria.

· for identifying quantities that would allow a student to determine r

· for correct equipment to measure the identified quantities

Example: V_R of the resistor with a voltmeter, emf of battery with a voltmeter, R with a resistance meter, or the label on the resistors.

Student response accurately includes one of the following criteria.

· for identifying quantities that would allow a student to determine r

· for correct equipment to measure the identified quantities

Example: V_R of the resistor with a voltmeter, emf of battery with a voltmeter, R with a resistance meter, or the label on the resistors.

Student response accurately includes two of the following criteria.

· for identifying quantities that would allow a student to determine r

· for correct equipment to measure the identified quantities

Example: V_R of the resistor with a voltmeter, emf of battery with a voltmeter, R with a resistance meter, or the label on the resistors.

title: Part (b)
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.
descriptions:
Student response does not accurately include the following criteria.

· for a procedure that will allow a student to measure quantities used to determine r

· for reducing error by doing a reasonable range of trials

· for keeping constant everything but the varied quantity

Example: Measure the potential difference across the resistor and the battery. Change the resistor, and measure the new potential difference across the resistor. Record the values of each. Repeat for many resistors.

Student response accurately includes one of the following criteria.

· for a procedure that will allow a student to measure quantities used to determine r

· for reducing error by doing a reasonable range of trials

· for keeping constant everything but the varied quantity

Example: Measure the potential difference across the resistor and the battery. Change the resistor, and measure the new potential difference across the resistor. Record the values of each. Repeat for many resistors.

Student response accurately includes two of the following criteria.

· for a procedure that will allow a student to measure quantities used to determine r

· for reducing error by doing a reasonable range of trials

· for keeping constant everything but the varied quantity

Example: Measure the potential difference across the resistor and the battery. Change the resistor, and measure the new potential difference across the resistor. Record the values of each. Repeat for many resistors.

Student response accurately includes three of the following criteria.

· for a procedure that will allow a student to measure quantities used to determine r

· for reducing error by doing a reasonable range of trials

· for keeping constant everything but the varied quantity

Example: Measure the potential difference across the resistor and the battery. Change the resistor, and measure the new potential difference across the resistor. Record the values of each. Repeat for many resistors.

title: Part (c)
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.
descriptions:
Student response does not accurately include the following criteria.

· for a pair of quantities that could be used to determine r

Example: 1/VR and 1/R

Student response accurately includes one of the following criteria.

· for a pair of quantities that could be used to determine r

Example: 1/VR and 1/R

title: Part (d)
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.
descriptions:
Student response does not accurately include the following criteria.

· for describing what feature of the graph would be used to determine r

· for describing how that feature would be used to determine r

Example: Graphing 1/VR vs. 1/R results in a linear graph. Slope of this graph is equal to r/ε which can be used to find the internal resistance of the battery.

Derivation (not required to be shown to earn credit)

Student response accurately includes one the following criteria.

· for describing what feature of the graph would be used to determine r

· for describing how that feature would be used to determine r

Example: Graphing 1/VR vs. 1/R results in a linear graph. Slope of this graph is equal to r/ε which can be used to find the internal resistance of the battery.

Derivation (not required to be shown to earn credit)

Student response accurately includes two the following criteria.

· for describing what feature of the graph would be used to determine r

· for describing how that feature would be used to determine r

Example: Graphing 1/VR vs. 1/R results in a linear graph. Slope of this graph is equal to r/ε which can be used to find the internal resistance of the battery.

Derivation (not required to be shown to earn credit)

title: Part (e)
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.
descriptions:
Student response does not accurately include the following criteria.

· for indicating that the internal resistance of the battery must be less than found experimentally

· for justifying their answer using physics principles

Example: The extra resistance of the wires would combine in series with the internal resistance, making the effective total internal resistance larger than expected. Therefore the actual internal resistance of only the battery is less than calculated.

Student response accurately includes one of the following criteria.

· or indicating that the internal resistance of the battery must be less than found experimentally

· for justifying their answer using physics principles

Example: The extra resistance of the wires would combine in series with the internal resistance, making the effective total internal resistance larger than expected. Therefore the actual internal resistance of only the battery is less than calculated.

Student response accurately includes two of the following criteria.

· or indicating that the internal resistance of the battery must be less than found experimentally

· for justifying their answer using physics principles

Example: The extra resistance of the wires would combine in series with the internal resistance, making the effective total internal resistance larger than expected. Therefore the actual internal resistance of only the battery is less than calculated.
